data.Title: Google Core Update Coming Soon
data.Description: Google has announced that the next core update to its search ranking algorithm is expected to roll out in the coming weeks.

data.Title: Google Discover May Offer Content Exclusion for Publishers
data.Description: Google may give publishers a way to exclude some of their content from Google Discover in the future.

data.Title: Google Tests Site-Level AI Content Classification Score
data.Description: Google may have a site-level AGC artificially generated AI classification score

data.Title: Google's Indifference to Site Publishers Explained
data.Description: Google inadvertently reveals reasons that explain their seeming indifference to publishers hurt by algorithm updates

data.Title: Google Confirms No Option to Block Content from Discover Feed
data.Description: Google confirms no option to block content from Discover, unlike News, highlighting limitations in crawling control.

data.Title: Google Renders All Pages for Search, Including JavaScript-Heavy Sites
data.Description: Google renders all webpages, including JavaScript-heavy sites, for search indexing.

data.Title: Google to Host More Creator Meetings
data.Description: Danny Sullivan from Google says he will be hosting more meetings with creators after a recent meeting with Brandon Saltalamacchia, the founder of Retro Dodo.

data.Title: Google Says Large Disavow Lists Shouldn't Worry Site Owners
data.Description: John Mueller from Google was asked if you should worry that massive link disavow lists can hurt you negatively and also if you remove the list that it might also hurt you.  John said you should not be worried at all, when he was asked how worried should you be, he said "zero."

data.Title: Google Search Tests Highlighting Words in Blue and Using Light Background Colors
data.Description: Google Search continues testing highlighting words in blue in the search results and using light background colors as well

data.Title: Google Search Tests "Back to AI Overview" Button
data.Description: After you scroll past the AI Overview, Google really wants you to go back to it

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Chat Feature Discontinued
data.Description: Google Business Profiles new chat feature no longer works. Make sure to download your chat history.

data.Title: Google Ending "Notes on Search" Experiment
data.Description: Google is discontinuing its "Notes on Search" experiment, which allowed users to add personal notes to search results. The feature was part of Google Search Labs but did not gain enough traction to warrant a full launch.

data.Title: June 2024 Core Web Vitals Data Shows Performance Gains, Impacting Page Experience Ranking
data.Description: Google's June 2024 Core Web Vitals (CWV) data shows performance gains across websites, which are expected to influence the Page Experience Ranking Factor in search results.

data.Title: Assessing Organic Search Ranking Drops: Key Questions and Tools
data.Description: 7 Key Questions and Tools to Assess Your Site Organic Search Rankings Drops

data.Title: The Impact of AI on SEO and Search
data.Description: AI has significantly changed how search engines work and, as a result, how SEO is done. From keyword research to content creation, AI is playing an increasingly important role in the search landscape.

data.Title: Building a Successful SEO Program in the Age of AI
data.Description: A guide on how to build a successful SEO program from the ground up in the age of artificial intelligence, emphasizing the importance of brand authority, high-quality content, and adaptability.

data.Title: The Importance of Human-Centric Content in the Age of AI
data.Description: Richard George takes on the debate about the role of humans in content creation.

data.Title: Content Mapping for Customer Journeys
data.Description: Aligning content with each phase of a buying journey helps drive shoppers to a purchase.

data.Title: Web Image Optimization: Best Practices for Speed and SEO in 2024
data.Description: Discover essential web image optimization techniques for 2024. Learn best practices for image compression, responsive images, lazy loading, and serving images.

data.Title: Schema.org Gets a Design Refresh
data.Description: Schema.org has a new design, it seems like the design went live this week. The Schema.org validator also looks fresh and new. It is unclear if there were any other changes made, outside of the design update.

data.Title: Why Use Google's Disavow Tool?
data.Description: There's one possible reason to disavow inbound links in circa 2024.

data.Title: Expert Link Building Tips for 2024
data.Description: The onslaught of artificial intelligence has wreaked havoc on the way content is created and perceived. Optimizing for search engines has undergone many changes but one of the factors that remain critical to optimization is backlinking. SERP ratings are highly impacted by backlinks as per 58.1% SEOs. With quality link building, this is achievable.

data.Title: Rogue SEO Specialists Defrauding High DA Publishers
data.Description: In the intricate world of digital marketing, Search Engine Optimization (SEO) stands as a cornerstone for enhancing online visibility and driving organic traffic to websites. However, this crucial aspect of online success is increasingly being exploited by unscrupulous individuals posing as SEO specialists.

data.Title: How Advisors Can Fix Holes in Their Digital Marketing and Do SEO Right
data.Description: Snappy Kraken CEO Robert Sofia reveals advisors' biggest mistakes and the best way to drive referrals, according to research.

data.Description: At Conscious Solutions, we have been helping law firms become more successful online for over 20 years. In that time, we have worked with all sizes of law firms with different budgets over different time frames

data.Title: Exa Raises $22MM to Build the Search Engine for AI
data.Description: Exa, a company developing a search engine specifically designed for artificial intelligence, has raised $22 million in funding to further its mission of revolutionizing how users find and interact with AI models and data.

data.Title: Thrasio Slims Down in Comeback Attempt
data.Description: The Amazon aggregator averaged one acquisition per week during the pandemic. Then it filed for bankruptcy.
